message_2:
To simplify the given rational expression, we can first factor out the common factors in the numerator and then cancel out the common factors in the numerator and the denominator.

(16x^2 + 48x) ÷ (8x)

Factor out the common factor of 16x in the numerator:

16x(x + 3) ÷ (8x)

Now, we can cancel out the common factor of 8x:

(16x ÷ 8x)(x + 3) ÷ (8x ÷ 8x)

2(x + 3) ÷ 1

The simplified rational expression is:

2(x + 3)
